meanings.definition: The final part of a joke that makes it funny.
meanings.sent1: The comedian delivered the punchline, and the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent2: The punchline of the joke caught everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent3: The clever punchline left everyone in stitches.
meanings.sent4: Her witty punchline was the cherry on top of the joke.
meanings.sent5: The punchline was so hilarious that it stayed with me all day.

meanings.definition: A line at the end of a story or speech that delivers a humorous or unexpected twist.
meanings.sent1: At the end of the story, the unexpected punchline made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent2: The speech ended with a brilliant punchline that left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent3: The clever punchline at the end of the tale made everyone giggle.
meanings.sent4: Her story had a punchline that lingered in the minds of the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The punchline at the end of the speech was so cleverly crafted.
